Common Issues

Why People Leave Cricket Wireless

5G Costs Extra

Unlike most competitors, Cricket charges additional fees for 5G access, making it more expensive to stay on the latest network technology.

Data Deprioritization

Cricket customers are always deprioritized behind AT&T postpaid customers, leading to slower speeds during peak usage times in busy areas.

Limited Plan Flexibility

Cricket's plans are rigid with limited customization options, and their cheapest plans have restrictive data caps of just 2-5GB.

Streaming Quality Limits

Video streaming is capped at SD quality (480p) on most Cricket plans, frustrating users who want HD content on their unlimited data.

FAQ

Switching from Cricket Wireless

Common questions about making the switch

Yes! You can port your Cricket phone number to any new carrier. The process is simple - just don't cancel Cricket before initiating the port. You'll need your Cricket account number and PIN, which you can find in your Cricket app or by calling customer service.

Since both Cricket and Vouch Mobile use the AT&T network, your Cricket phone will work seamlessly with Vouch Mobile. Cricket phones are typically unlocked if you've had service for at least 6 months, but even if locked, they should work fine on another AT&T MVNO.

The top reasons Cricket customers switch include: paying extra for 5G access, experiencing slow speeds due to deprioritization during peak hours, wanting better unlimited plan pricing, and frustration with video streaming quality caps. Vouch Mobile solves all these issues on the same AT&T network.

Yes! Both Vouch Mobile and Cricket are AT&T MVNOs, meaning they use the exact same cell towers and network infrastructure. You'll get identical coverage - the difference is Vouch Mobile offers better pricing and includes 5G at no extra charge.

Cricket's unlimited plan costs $55/month, while Vouch Mobile's unlimited plan is just $30/month - that's $25/month in savings, or $300 per year. Plus, you get 5G included free with Vouch Mobile, which Cricket charges extra for.
